page.title: 01 The GEAR Project.
page.content: The Glasgow Eastern Area Renewal fund was set up in the Seventies to overcome the decline of the East End.The priorities were jobs, housing, environment and the quality of life.The project has cost millions of pounds already and many organisations have contributed. People in the area used to work in huge engineering factories, but now most of them are closed.G.E.A.R. has set up new factory units, and training schemes for young people.Most of the old tenements have been renovated and hundreds of new houses, many of them privately owned, have been built. Many historical buildings have been restored and the environment has been improved by landscaping, tree planting and the creation of all kinds of recreation areas, from small play parks to the huge Crownpoint Complex.
